article:
A 'source' or 'sender' is one of the basic concepts of communication and
information processing. Sources are objects which message data and transmit the
information, via a channel, to one or more observers (or receivers).

In the strictest sense of the word, particularly in information theory, a source
is a process that generates message data that one would like to communicate, or
reproduce as exactly as possible somewhere else in space or time. A source may
be modelled as memoryless, ergodic, stationary, or stochastic, in order of
increasing generality.
